ServantIntolerant.synopsis: Marcoryl is only too delighted to fight the tieflings. This is during the druid attack and he is eager to put down these 'hellspawn.'

Griefling.synopsis: Arka reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings in the grove.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.synopsis: Lovers go back to packing after attack on Den.

AD_ParentA.synopsis: The druid attack has begun. Lock yells for everyone to hide and then quietly reassures the other tieflings around him to keep quiet and stay calm. He is a voice of reason and assurance.

YoungLover02.synopsis: Bex reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings.

IrritatedTiefling.synopsis: Guex reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings in the grove, and  if the tieflings defeat their attackers.

VoloBear.synopsis: The bear is about to attack us, because we comitted a crime. Imagine him very angry, his hackles raised and growling.

ServantGnome.synopsis: Loic has lost all his patience in this dialogue - you commited a crime, and he's really angry and disgusted. This happens right before he starts to attack the player.

AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack.synopsis: Eramas is looking around the adventurers' spot in the Grove for useful stuff for the incoming goblin fight.

RobberKid.synopsis: Child pickpocket reacts ot the druid attack, and player's success in that attack.

ExcitedBoar.synopsis: This boar was friendly to the player before. Now the player has committed a crime, and the boar feels betrayed. He's about to attack.

SnakeKid.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack.synopsis: Three tieflings (who had previously been protesting their treatment at the hands of their druid hosts) react to the aftermath of a bloody confrontation between tiefling refugees and druids. In this instance the druids have all been killed. The refugees are shaken and angry.

Refugee004.synopsis: Toron reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings.

RitualDruid2.synopsis: Kerrick has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.

RitualDruid4.synopsis: Elwyn has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She regrets that this has to happen, but will do what needs to be done.
RitualDruid4.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game 2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe startdruidattack4. oe druidattackkilldruids5. goto 235.409; 14.982; 504.5956, Talk with Elwyn

AD_TieflingLeader.synopsis: Zevlor is a leader who hears commotion between his followers and a rival faction. These lines trigger from when he first hears the noise, investigates, sees a confrontation brewing to when fighting actually starts.

RitualDruid5.synopsis: Tahani has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's anxious to fight - she sees the tieflings as foreign invaders that need to be driven out.

DruidLeader.synopsis: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile. In case player clicks on druid before hostility is fully set.

PetWolf.synopsis: This wolf is about to attack the other druids. He's full of energy and anticipation.

AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack.synopsis: Guex is training on his own for the incoming goblin attack. Swinging his sword.

Gatekeeper.synopsis: Elegis is the gatekeeper for the grove. She is grim but determined to keep her kin safe as the druids attack.

RitualDruid1.synopsis: Aelar has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.

ScoutCaptive.synopsis: A druid we saved from some goblins earlier - regretfully telling us it's too late to leave - his people are going to kill us.lNPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.

Pickpocket.synopsis: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Silfy is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's terrified and thinks a theft may have triggered the attack. Afterward, she's back to her shy self.

AD_YoungLover01.synopsis: Danis reacts to the tiefling refugees (himself included) being attacked by the druids.

AD_Tiefling001.synopsis: ADs when the character is fighting a bunch of druids - she's angry, scared and full of adrenaline.

Protester3.synopsis: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning hostile against all the tieflings (both during and after battle).

YoungLover01.synopsis: Danis reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings.

Trainer.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.synopsis: Dammon is working to supply weapons and armour for the raid while Lakrissa and Rikka bother him during his work.

Prodigy.synopsis: Rolan is being Rolan here - full of pride and arrogance, even as he begrudingly admits that the player played a large part in defending them from the druids.

Chef.synopsis: This dialogues occurs after the druid attack. Okta is relieved that they survived and drained from being tierrified (not that she would admit it). She's trying to be tough and no nonsense about the entire event.

HideoutLeader.synopsis: During and after the druid attack, Mol is frustrated and a little anxious rather than scared. If she made a deal with the player, tough and resilient when discussing it.

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.synopsis: Tone: People trying to act somewhast normal under grave circumstances. Intreactions are intoned with gravity.The Bard is inside the kid hideout with the rest of the kids, supposedly keeping an eye on them as they are not to go outside the hideout anymore with the incoming goblin attack. Zaki is trying to act older and not scared and Alfira is playing along with it.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack.synopsis: Trainees are bickering over who would be better to deal with the druids and the bears, after the attack has resolved and the player has taken down the druids.

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.synopsis: Okta is preparing meals for the road and Ikaron is snooping around the hag's corner, against his mother's pleas.

PrisonGuard.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.synopsis: Parents are mourning the death of their child after the druid attack. They hang around the grove and wonder what will follow.

SonOfChef.synopsis: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Ikaron is entirely focused on saving his people from the druids. Afterward, he's introspective, hurt that he and his people have had another safe harbour turn against him. Still, he is glad the players were there to help win the day.

GrieflingFriend.synopsis: Memnos reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings. If the tieflings prevail, he reacts to this also.

Bard.synopsis: Alfira is scared but trying to hold it together during the attack. She is with the children in the hideout. She isn't a fighter but is prepared to lay down her life to protect them. She stays in the hideout with the children afterwards.After the attack, if the player has stolen or broken her instrument she is thankful but wary of the player. Otherwise she is grateful that someone has finally stuck by the tieflings.

TieflingLeader.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.

Trainee001.synopsis: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Umi is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. He's frightened while they are attacking, and clearly shaken afterward.

AD_Tiefling011.synopsis: Zorru calls out his reactions in ADs during different states of the druid attack.

ElevatorBear.synopsis: This bear is about to attack, but she just woke up, and she's still sleepy.

Scammer.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.

Tiefling011.synopsis: Zorru one-liner reacting to druid attack state. Zorru has a proven dislike of githyanki, so those reactions are a bit different.

Tiefling005.synopsis: Pandirna is guard who is either 1) sprawled on the ground, unable to move. 2) healed due to the player's help. If she's healed, she is ready for a fight and eager to prove herself and protect those she loved. If she paralyzed, she just wants the player to protect the other tieflings - she's convinced she'll die. If she survives, she thanks the player - knowing it is directly because of them that she survived.

ParentB.synopsis: Marrick is hidden alongside the other tieflings during the attack but is unafraid. She is no fighter but if the druids reach her she will fight to her last breath. In her post attack dialogues, if her daughter has died her anger is waning even as she strives to hold onto it - the grief settling in as she realises all the dead druids in the world won't bring her daughter back.If her daughter in the post attack she is full of righteous anger - let anyone in the world take on the tieflings. They won't back down from anything.
ParentB.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. oe startdruidattack3. oe druidattackkilldruids4. goto -43 775. Talk with Marricko

ParentA.synopsis: Locke is hidden alongside multiple other tieflings as the druids attack the grove. In his post attack lines he is grim and depressed if his daughter is dead (even as he thanks the player.) If his daughter is alive, he is saddened that violence occured but thankful the player was there to help.
ParentA.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. oe startdruidattack3. oe druidattackkilldruids4. goto -43 775. Talk to Locke

AD_DruidOpposed.synopsis: Rath is defending the tieflings as Sagha and the other druids attempt to drive them out.

Tiefling010.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.

AD_SonOfChef.synopsis: These lines play when the druids launch an attack against the tieflings in the druid grove. Ikaron's been on edge for a while, afraid something like this would happen. He doesn't hesitate to fight back - he's had enough of his people getting pushed around.

PickpocketTrader.synopsis: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Lim is hidden away with the other tiefling children. She's fairly calm, given the situation - she's used to getting out of binds. Afterward, she's already plotting how she might get out ahead, though she's a bit irked at the player for getting rid of a source of income.

ProdigyBrother.synopsis: Cal is fighting the people who once hosted them in the grove. He'll do it to protect the tieflings but he hates it - he would much prefer a peaceful resolution.

ProdigySister.synopsis: Lia will defend her fellow tieflings to the death. She does not shy away from violence and is prepared to fight ever druid in the grove if it means saving her people.
ProdigySister.how_to_trigger: from crashsitein reCon: teleport S_GLO_ProdigySisterclick on Lia, go through dialogue and convince them to stay and fight oe startdruidattackteleport S_GLO_ProdigySisterclick on Lia

AD_Refugee004.synopsis: Toron, a tiefling, reacts to the druids attacking him and the other refugees sheltering in the grove.

ServantPlight.synopsis: The player committed a crime, and this druid is extremely disappointed, but doesn't want to attack, so implores the player to leave. He knows a fight will break out in mere minutes.

RitualDruid3.synopsis: Inwe has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's calm and serious - she doesn't want to fight, but she will.
RitualDruid3.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe startdruidattack4. oe druidattackkilldruids5. goto 245.884; 15.103; 513.916. Talk with Inwe

Trainee002.synopsis: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Ide is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's frightened while they are attacking, but shakes it off quickly afterward. She's just impressed that the player could take on so many druids.

RangerTrader.synopsis: This dialogue has two states: getting ready for battle and after the battle.
RangerTrader.how_to_trigger: from crashsite:in reCon: oe startdruidattackteleport S_DEN_TieflingRefugee_RangerTrader_001

Protester1.synopsis: A tiefling refugee reacts to the conflict with the druids (during and after)

DruidGuard003.synopsis: Spoken just before the Druids turn hostile against the tiefling refugees.

GruntingKid.synopsis: Tiefling kid who communicates by grunting during and after druid attack

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.synopsis: Kaldani wants to cut down some trees after the druid attack

Tiefling004.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.

Stargazer.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.

AD_Trainer.synopsis: Asharak is training kids when he hears commotion breaking out - he investigates to find the druid faction are attacking his people.

BirdSender.synopsis: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.

AD_ServantPlight.synopsis: A battle is breaking out between the tieflings and the druids. This druid has previously tried to help the tieflings, and he is more surprised and sad than angry. He prays to his god that what they are doing is right.

Tiefling001.synopsis: This dialogue has two states: one where the character is getting attacked and is panicked, and one for after the attack, where she is trying to calm down, but killing other people is making her feel sick.

LINE_DruidToCombat.synopsis: The player angered the druids by tampering with the Idol of Silvanus of by performing a serious crime.Kagha reacts if it's triggering near her. Otherwise, 'generic' druids are used for the off screen voices and call to arms shot.Can also trigger if the player goes hostile to Kagha in dialogue.
LINE_DruidToCombat.how_to_trigger: Steal the Idol of Silvanus or anger a druid with a serious crime.If a combat already starter, this plays on the player's turnsAll players in the druids and tieflings area are added to this transition dialog

DruidOpposed.synopsis: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.

CharmedKid.synopsis: Two states: one where the child is about to get attacked by the druids and is panicking, and one where the player has saved him and he's grateful.
CharmedKid.how_to_trigger: select player characterin reCon: addTag BARBARIANteleport S_DEN_CharmedKidtrigger dialogue DEN_HarpyMeal_CharmedVictimgo through these choices- You shouldn't be standing out in the water. It's dangerous.-  Focus and try to hear what he hears.-  Struggle against the music's pull. (roll amazing)- Roar at the top of your lungs to overpower the voice.dialogue exitskillcombatclick through next dialogue (spacebar all the way)oe startdruidattackteleport S_DEN_CharmedKid

Wyll.synopsis: Wyll's dialogue before and after Druid attack state. This is secondary recruitment state, if you trigger druid attack before he is recruited.

ZenBear.synopsis: This bear is still struck with grief because his master hasn't returned, but he's also incredibly angry because the player has committed a crime.

Trainee003.synopsis: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Gan is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's full of bravado - she's had training with a wooden sword, and she's eager to show off. She doesn't quite grasp the seriousness of the situation.

Protester2.synopsis: A tiefling refugee reacts to the druids turning on him and his companions (both during and post-combat)

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.synopsis: Asharak and Zevlor are at the entrance and walking around together as they envision what sort of defense they can mount on the walls.

DruidGuard001.synopsis: Jeorna, speaking just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.

Kid004.synopsis: Kid responses related to druid attack.

AD_FoodTrader.synopsis: Okta is hidden with the other tieflings. She is determined to sacrifice herself to save the others if needs be. The druid attack is on going.

DruidGuard002.synopsis: Maggran (the bear-druid guard, now in human form again) shouts aggresively before he and the other druids turn hostile on the players and the tiefling refugees.

AD_DruidLeader.synopsis: Kagha shouts her ADs during the attack phase.

AD_DruidGuard1.synopsis: Jeorna, a druid, shouts orders and battle cries after she and her fellow druids turn on the tielfings. Fanatical and aggressive.

AD_FleeAfter.synopsis: AD when Zorru flees attack on grove. He's fearful and running for his life.

AD_Apprentice.synopsis: Nettie and the other druids are forced to drive out the tieflings by force. ADs cover the attack, moving to attack position, and ADs while Nettie's waiting to strike. Nettie doesn't want to kill anyone, and hopes the tieflings will leave until the very end, but will fight if she needs to.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.synopsis: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Dammon fights against the druids. He's provided the tieflings with their weapons, and he hopes they're up to the task. Afterward, he's back at his forge, repairing the weapons that were damaged in the skirmish.
Weaponsmith_PostEA.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A- oe denraiddone- goto 201.54, 26.07, 537.98- oe startdruidattack- Wait until the attack starts- oe druidattackkilldruids- Wait till all the tieflings come back - goto 176.13, 19.28, 561.44- Speak to Dammon

AD_HideoutLeader.synopsis: Two scared young tieflings: Mol protects Zavi during the druid attack

Apprentice.synopsis: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.

reasoning: The 'Druid Attack' is a central event that triggers various reactions from different characters. Sessions related to characters responding to this attack should logically follow after the 'Druid Attack' begins.

Sessions such as 'AD_ParentA', 'ServantIntolerant', 'Griefling', and 'YoungLover02' depict characters reacting to the druids attacking the tieflings, indicating that these must occur after the druid attack starts.

After the attack is resolved, sessions like 'AD_ParentsAfterAttack', 'AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack', and 'AD_TraineesAfterAttack' depict characters dealing with the aftermath, which means they must follow the sessions related to the attack.

Certain sessions are mutually exclusive due to their context. For example, sessions where characters are reacting to the attack cannot coincide with sessions where they are shown as safe or unscathed during the same timeline.

ServantIntolerant_0.speaker: Marcoryl
ServantIntolerant_0.context: NodeContext: Vicious and cruel - you are eager to spill tiefling blood

Griefling_0.speaker: Arka
Griefling_0.text: Backstabbing filth. Good riddance to the lot of them.
Griefling_0.context: NodeContext: Lingering anger, She survived an attack by the druids, who'd originally offer her and her people shelter.

Griefling_1.speaker: Arka
Griefling_1.text: If we can survive the druids, we might survive the goblins.

Griefling_2.speaker: Arka
Griefling_2.text: Druids are up to something - get ready for a fight.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_0.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_0.text: Goblins might not even come. Right?

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_1.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_1.text: Keep up the pace, Bex. Baldur's Gate won't wait forever.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_5.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_5.text: Maybe should I go help defend the wall.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_2.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_2.text: You're no fighter. And I need you here.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_6.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_6.text: When did Zevlor say we're leaving?

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_7.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack_7.text: He didn't, love. It still isn't safe. Goblins, you know.

AD_ParentA_0.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentA_0.context: NodeContext: Whispered - trying to keep everyone calm during the attack.

AD_ParentA_1.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentA_1.context: NodeContext: Whispered - trying to keep everyone calm during the attack.

AD_ParentA_2.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentA_2.context: NodeContext: Trying to remain calm - actually afraid. Voice of reason and assurance.

AD_ParentA_3.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentA_3.text: Stay close. We'll get through this.
AD_ParentA_3.context: NodeContext: Whispered - trying to keep everyone calm during the attack.

YoungLover02_1.speaker: Bex
YoungLover02_1.text: Thought this place was pretty when we first arrived. Slaughterhouse now.
YoungLover02_1.context: NodeContext: Survived the druid attack, Relieved and exhausted

YoungLover02_2.speaker: Bex
YoungLover02_2.context: NodeContext: Survived the druid attack, Relieved and exhausted

IrritatedTiefling_1.speaker: Guex
IrritatedTiefling_1.text: Still have the goblins to deal with. Can't let our guard down just yet.
IrritatedTiefling_1.context: NodeContext: 'not out of the woods yet'

IrritatedTiefling_2.speaker: Guex
IrritatedTiefling_2.text: So much for the druids. Looks like all my sword training did some good.
IrritatedTiefling_2.context: NodeContext: relieved to have survived the druid attack

VoloBear_2.speaker: Bosk
VoloBear_2.text: We welcomed you, and now this?

AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack_1.speaker: Eramas
AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack_1.text: I can't believe they just left this all behind.

AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack_2.speaker: Eramas
AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack_2.text: Gah! When was the last time these were washed?

AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack_3.speaker: Eramas
AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack_3.text: There has to be something useful in here.

RobberKid_0.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_0.text: You can beat them, can't you?

RobberKid_1.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_1.text: Is it true some of the rats were druids? I used to have a pet rat.

RobberKid_2.speaker: Meli
RobberKid_2.text: Suppose you get first pick of the loot, but leave something for us.

ExcitedBoar_0.speaker: Tusk
ExcitedBoar_0.text: I should've known. All two-legs are the same!

ExcitedBoar_1.speaker: Tusk
ExcitedBoar_1.text: Start running, two-legs - I'll be right behind you.
ExcitedBoar_1.context: NodeContext: a threat, not a friendly sentence

SnakeKid_0.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid_0.context: NodeContext: whispered, barely audible, head down

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_1.speaker: Amek
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_1.text: Couldn't be helped. Those druids left us no choice.
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_1.context: NodeContext: 'We did what we had to'

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_3.speaker: Xeph
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_3.text: Still got to face the goblins before we can go anywhere.
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_3.context: NodeContext: 'We're not out of the woods'

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_2.speaker: Rechel
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_2.text: Druids, goblins... and then what? There'll be other things looking to kill us. There always is.

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_4.speaker: Amek
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_4.text: I wonder what'll happen to this place now...?

AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_5.speaker: Xeph
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_5.text: It can rot for all I care. The sooner we can safely leave this place behind, the better.
AD_ProtestersAfterAttack_5.context: NodeContext: Still angry about what happened.

Refugee004_0.speaker: Toron
Refugee004_0.text: We stood our own, I'll admit. Looks like we'll have to do it again with the goblins.
Refugee004_0.context: NodeContext: Anticipating danger yet to come

Refugee004_1.speaker: Toron
Refugee004_1.text: They actually did it - those bloody druids have turned on us!

Refugee004_2.speaker: Toron
Refugee004_2.text: A pile of dead druids, and the rest of us weakened before another fight. Perfect.
Refugee004_2.context: NodeContext: He's survived the druids' attack, but is hardly happy about the outlook

RitualDruid2_0.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2_0.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

RitualDruid4_0.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4_0.text: I'm sorry. But this must be done.
RitualDruid4_0.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

AD_TieflingLeader_3.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeader_3.text: I won't let you threaten my people.

AD_TieflingLeader_6.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeader_6.text: Let's just stop and speak for a second.

AD_TieflingLeader_9.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeader_9.text: Torm's truth, what is it now?

RitualDruid5_0.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5_0.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

DruidLeader_0.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader_0.text: The brood is restless. The mother strikes!

PetWolf_0.speaker: Silver
PetWolf_0.text: Master says you're good. Told me to protect you. But one wrong move, and your flesh is mine.

PetWolf_1.speaker: Silver
PetWolf_1.text: I will get the snake. Master always told me no. But not anymore.

AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack_.speaker: Guex
AD_IrritatedTieflingTrainingAfterAttack_.text: Hrah! Do you like that, Kagha?

Gatekeeper_0.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_0.text: We no longer need to fear a dagger in the back from our kindly hosts. Thank you - for standing by us.

Gatekeeper_2.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper_2.text: Now we need only concern ourselves with goblins, gnolls and whatever else has their eyes on the grove.

RitualDruid1_0.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1_0.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

ScoutCaptive_0.speaker: Findal
ScoutCaptive_0.text: You should have left while you could.

Pickpocket_0.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_0.text: I think we made those animal people mad.
Pickpocket_0.context: NodeContext: One of the other tiefling children stole an idol from the druids - she thinks they're attacking because they're mad about that. She's scared.

Pickpocket_1.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_1.text: I'm glad it's over... those bear people were scary.
Pickpocket_1.context: NodeContext: The 'bear people' are the druids that tried to kill all of the tieflings. The battle is over.

Pickpocket_2.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_2.text: Um... thank you for helping us...
Pickpocket_2.context: NodeContext: She's thanking the player for fighting against the druids with the tieflings.

AD_YoungLover01_1.speaker: Danis
AD_YoungLover01_1.text: Got to hide. Find someplace safe...

AD_YoungLover01_2.speaker: Danis
AD_YoungLover01_2.text: The druids have gone mad - keep back!

AD_Tiefling001_3.speaker: Rikka
AD_Tiefling001_3.text: Don't let them get any closer!

AD_Tiefling001_8.speaker: Rikka
AD_Tiefling001_8.context: NodeContext: She's trying to encourage herself.

Protester3_0.speaker: Xeph
Protester3_0.text: Thought we were safe here. But nowhere's safe, is it?
Protester3_0.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Even in victory, attitude's a little defeated.

Protester3_1.speaker: Xeph
Protester3_1.text: The druids have turned on us - defend yourself!

Protester3_2.speaker: Xeph
Protester3_2.text: I was so relieved when we found this place. Now I can't wait to put it behind me.
Protester3_2.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Even in victory, attitude's a little defeated.

YoungLover01_0.speaker: Danis
YoungLover01_0.text: I thought druids were peaceful sorts - nature-lovers. Shows what I know.

YoungLover01_2.speaker: Danis
YoungLover01_2.text: We were lucky this time. Next time, who knows?

Trainer_0.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_0.text: Get ready. It's happening. Just as I feared...

Trainer_1.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_1.text: Keep a good eye out. I don't trust anything anymore.

Trainer_2.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_2.text: I can't believe they turned on us. I suppose I can but... there are children here.

Trainer_4.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_4.text: I thought druids valued life. Shows what I know.

Trainer_6.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_6.text: We'd best prepare for the worst. If more goblins come now, we won't stand a chance. Out of the cookpan...

Trainer_3.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_3.text: We need to prepare the gate. The threat inside is gone, but it's a wild world out here.

Trainer_5.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_5.text: High time we put an end to every enemy that's haunted us here. You've given us that chance. We won't waste it.

Trainer_7.speaker: Asharak
Trainer_7.text: We won't forget what you did for us. You're one of us now. Always.

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_0.speaker: Rikka
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_0.text: I do need some armour, you know.

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_3.speaker: Dammon
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_3.text: Can't outfit all of you at once.

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_8.speaker: Rikka
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_8.text: Is this gonna hold up if those goblins come back?

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_5.speaker: Dammon
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_5.text: Served you against the druids, didn't it?

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_9.speaker: Rikka
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_9.text: I'm worried. I don't think we're ready.

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_1.speaker: Dammon
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack_1.text: Lakrissa's right. Can only do what we can.

Prodigy_0.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_0.text: So you can handle yourself. Not bad - those druids really should have known better.

Prodigy_1.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy_1.text: Let them come! I'll end them with a single spell.
Prodigy_1.context: NodeContext: In the middle of a fight - fired up and eager to prove yourself.

Chef_0.speaker: Okta
Chef_0.text: Least there's plenty of wood for the fire with the druids gone.

Chef_1.speaker: Okta
Chef_1.text: I'll give any druid that comes near me a backhand their mother will feel.

Chef_4.speaker: Okta
Chef_4.text: Sorry, no gruel on the pot today.

Chef_2.speaker: Okta
Chef_2.text: Now that this druid mess is over, I'm having to store up all the rations I can.

Chef_3.speaker: Okta
Chef_3.text: Which... isn't much. But we'll make do.

HideoutLeader_4.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_4.text: Nothing to see here. We're clearing out soon.
HideoutLeader_4.context: NodeContext: dismissive - she's attending to other business, helping her gang to pack up

HideoutLeader_5.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_5.text: You're alive! Did you get the idol? Is that why they went crazy?
HideoutLeader_5.context: NodeContext: surprised, pleased, slightly breathless - she has been hiding from an attack, and just realised it's over

HideoutLeader_16.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader_16.text: Doesn't matter. It's over - and the idol's all yours.

HideoutLeader_13.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_13.text: Thanks. See you in Baldur's Gate, I hope. Now scram, before I get emotional.

HideoutLeader_21.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader_21.text: Yes. And after what I just went through, I'm keeping the damn thing.

HideoutLeader_15.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_15.text: Can't say I blame you. But we did have a deal.
HideoutLeader_15.context: NodeContext: disappointed, trying to elicit sympathy

HideoutLeader_11.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader_11.text: And now the deal's off. Bye, kid.

HideoutLeader_8.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_8.text: Fine. Hope the damn thing's cursed.
HideoutLeader_8.context: NodeContext: frustrated, but not shouting, as she's dismissed. The 'damn thing' is an idol the player stole and refused to give to her

HideoutLeader_0.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader_0.text: Here's some free advice, more valuable than gold: don't bargain, just take.

HideoutLeader_20.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_20.text: Sounds more like a challenge than advice. Keep an eye on your pack.
HideoutLeader_20.context: NodeContext: frustrated but with a hint of admiration. Last line is a threat to rob us in the future (pack is backpack). We just conned her, but she learned something from us.

HideoutLeader_22.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader_22.text: I don't have it. Let's just be glad we're alive.

HideoutLeader_3.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_3.context: NodeContext: Frustrated to have lost out on a treasure

HideoutLeader_6.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader_6.text: Not sure what happened to the idol.

HideoutLeader_2.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_2.text: Damn it. Having that stashed away would have made life a lot easier.
HideoutLeader_2.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed. Possible stamp of the foot on 'damn it'. Clenched fists.

HideoutLeader_17.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader_17.text: I didn't touch the idol. No idea who pissed them off.

HideoutLeader_1.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_1.text: You're a terrible liar. We had a deal.
HideoutLeader_1.context: NodeContext: Frustrated, disappointed - player just lied to her and she saw right through it.

HideoutLeader_10.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_10.text: If any of your stuff goes missing, just let me know. You're family now.

HideoutLeader_18.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_18.text: Somebody stole the idol. If I find out who it was... I'll recruit 'em.
HideoutLeader_18.context: NodeContext: exasperated on first line, as she tells us something we gave her was stolen. Beat before final phrase and delivered with a smile - it's a fun line but she's serious about recruiting good thieves

HideoutLeader_23.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader_23.text: I knew they wanted us dead. I knew it!

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_0.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_0.text: We're not scared. We can handle ourselves.
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_0.context: NodeContext: Trying to act older than you are.

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_7.speaker: Alfira
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_7.text: I know. Perhaps you can give me some pointers?
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_7.context: NodeContext: Smiling and relaxed - trying to be friendly

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_2.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_2.text: Why did Mol let you in, anyway?

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_8.speaker: Alfira
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_8.text: Even your boss can't resist a good story.
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_8.context: NodeContext: Smiling and relaxed - trying to be friendly

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_3.speaker: Alfira
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_3.text: Not yet, I'm afraid. Just a bit longer, all right?
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_3.context: NodeContext: a little somber but you're trying to reassure the kid

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_6.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_6.text: How long will you be down here, anyway?

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_4.speaker: Alfira
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_4.text: Just until it's safe to go out. Don't worry. How about a story in the meantime?
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_4.context: NodeContext: Smiling and relaxed - trying to be friendly

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_1.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack_1.context: NodeContext: A little petulant sounding but you actually really wanted a story

AD_TraineesAfterAttack_4.speaker: Gan
AD_TraineesAfterAttack_4.text: Where do you think your mum is now?

AD_TraineesAfterAttack_9.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack_9.text: Dunno. Somewhere good. Far away. I hope.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack_10.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack_10.text: I got three. Or five. I forget.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack_11.speaker: Gan
AD_TraineesAfterAttack_11.text: Why didn't those druids like us?

AD_TraineesAfterAttack_0.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack_0.text: No one likes us. Cause we're tieflings.

AD_TraineesAfterAttack_2.speaker: Ide
AD_TraineesAfterAttack_2.text: Don't say that. It's their fault, not ours.

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_1.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_1.text: Eerie little black rock. Wonder what it does?

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_4.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_4.text: Probably rots your fingers off. Leave it be!

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_5.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_5.text: Do I have to drag you out of there by the horns?

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_6.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_6.text: I'm just curious! Her knick-knacks could be worth something.

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_7.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_7.text: Son, stay out of that old woman's things.

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_0.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack_0.text: Come on. You can't tell me you're not curious.

PrisonGuard_0.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard_0.text: You look ready. Wish it were contagious.

PrisonGuard_1.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard_1.text: No point hanging around. We need to get ready for... for whatever comes next.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_0.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_0.text: Think she'll be all right with the other kids?

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_9.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_9.text: Mol will keep an eye on her.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_1.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_1.text: Mol isn't exactly my first choice as a guardian.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_7.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_7.text: Goblins are ruthless, but have you met that kid? She'll look after Arabella. No doubt.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_6.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_6.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm your wife. Strong and assured.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_5.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_5.text: Our baby's gone. There could never be a point.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_10.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_10.text: Arabella is holed up with the others.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_3.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_3.context: NodeContext: Thinking of Arabella - hoping she'll be safe

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_11.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_11.text: Do you think she's watching us?

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_13.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_13.text: I don't know anything. Not anymore.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_12.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_12.text: Let the bloody goblins take us. I miss my baby.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack_4.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack_4.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm your wife. Strong and assured.

SonOfChef_0.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_0.text: We should be used to the knives in our backs by now.
SonOfChef_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arms crossed.NodeContext: His people have been betrayed - yet again - through no fault of their own. The druids have been dealt with.

SonOfChef_3.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_3.text: Good thing you were with us.
SonOfChef_3.context: NodeContext: Sighing a bit, trying to find a positive in the situation. The druids have been dealt with.

SonOfChef_1.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_1.text: I hope you're here when the goblins make their move.
SonOfChef_1.context: NodeContext: He doesn't like their chances, but knows they'd be better with the player to fight with them.The druids have been dealt with, but the goblin attack still looms.

SonOfChef_2.speaker: Ikaron
SonOfChef_2.text: Pick up a weapon and fight, damn it!
SonOfChef_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon drawn.NodeContext: In the middle of a fight - the druids are attacking.

GrieflingFriend_0.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_0.text: These druids are insane - why are they doing this?!

GrieflingFriend_1.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_1.text: Leave me be, please. Need to... need to gather my wits.
GrieflingFriend_1.context: NodeContext: Shocked and relieved to have survived the druids' attack

GrieflingFriend_2.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend_2.text: The druids... they're all dead. Up to Kelemvor to judge them now.
GrieflingFriend_2.context: NodeContext: Shocked and relieved to have survived the druids' attack

Bard_5.speaker: Alfira
Bard_5.text: You're a person with many faces.

Bard_1.speaker: Alfira
Bard_1.text: I'll never forget what you did to my lute. But thank you. You bought the little ones time to hide.

Bard_2.speaker: Alfira
Bard_2.text: I think I'll stay to keep an eye on this lot.

Bard_3.speaker: Alfira
Bard_3.text: Keep them away from the kids - please.

Bard_4.speaker: Alfira
Bard_4.text: That's twice you saved us now. Thank you. You bought enough time for the little ones to hide.

TieflingLeader_1.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_1.text: Please - come speak with me in the cave. I have an urgent matter to discuss with you.

TieflingLeader_2.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_2.text: I knew Kagha had twisted them, but for so many to turn on us...

TieflingLeader_0.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_0.text: Thank you for standing with us. I need to check on my people, but come see me when you have a chance.

TieflingLeader_3.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_3.text: Prepare yourself - I believe the druids are moving on us.

TieflingLeader_4.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_4.text: Let's talk later. Our troubles aren't over yet - the goblins are still out there.

TieflingLeader_5.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader_5.text: To think that this place was once a refuge.

Trainee001_0.speaker: Umi
Trainee001_0.text: I just want to go home.
Trainee001_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down, sadNodeContext: The druids are dealt with. He just wants to go back home and be safe again.

Trainee001_1.speaker: Umi
Trainee001_1.text: They're supposed to be our friends.
Trainee001_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cowering.NodeContext: Crying. The druids have turned on her people and are trying to slaughter them.

Trainee001_2.speaker: Umi
Trainee001_2.text: Everyone hates us. But we didn't do anything.
Trainee001_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down, sadNodeContext: The druids are dealt with. He's coming to terms with a real harsh truth here.

AD_Tiefling011_1.speaker: Zorru
AD_Tiefling011_1.text: Damn it - they just keep coming!

AD_Tiefling011_3.speaker: Zorru
AD_Tiefling011_3.text: My blade is ready. Let them come!

AD_Tiefling011_6.speaker: Zorru
AD_Tiefling011_6.text: You won't get the best of me!

AD_Tiefling011_7.speaker: Zorru
AD_Tiefling011_7.text: This is the end of you!

ElevatorBear_0.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_0.context: NodeContext: Second line where she's a bit more awake. The previous line was "You *yawn* woke me up!"

ElevatorBear_1.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear_1.context: NodeContext: There's a big yawn after the ellipsis

Scammer_0.speaker: Nerela
Scammer_0.context: NodeContext: She's trying to act natural.

Scammer_1.speaker: Nerela
Scammer_1.text: There's nothing left those rats can take from me.

Scammer_2.speaker: Nerela
Scammer_2.text: Oh! Hi. Hello. You surprised me. But - erm - thank you! For your help with the druids. A real star, you are.
Scammer_2.context: NodeContext: She's a shady character. You caught her doing something shady.

Tiefling011_0.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling011_0.text: We're stronger than we thought. And the druid fight is proof.

Tiefling011_1.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling011_1.text: Elturel. Hostile druids. Is nowhere safe?

Tiefling011_2.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling011_2.text: We survived this, and goblins too. Maybe we do have a chance.

Tiefling005_0.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_0.text: I was able to wiggle a toe earlier - I guess that potion is finally wearing off. Terrible timing, as usual.

Tiefling005_1.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_1.text: I can't believe I survived. Thank you - if they'd got to me... well, thank you.

Tiefling005_2.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_2.text: After this, I know we'll make it to Baldur's Gate. We've fought too hard not to.

Tiefling005_4.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_4.text: Because of you, I could protect the people I call family. Thank you. It was good to fight at your side.

Tiefling005_5.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005_5.text: I couldn't fight the goblins - but I'll make damn sure I get those druids.

ParentB_0.speaker: Komira
ParentB_0.text: Thanks for gutting the druid bastards. Only wish I could've taken a few myself.

ParentB_1.speaker: Komira
ParentB_1.text: With Kagha dead, I thought I'd feel better. I just miss my daughter more.

ParentB_2.speaker: Komira
ParentB_2.text: I knew those druids would turn on us. Well, we won't go quietly.
ParentB_2.context: NodeContext: Readying yourself for a fight - even though you know you'll die.

ParentB_3.speaker: Komira
ParentB_3.text: Goblins, worgs, gnolls - let them all come. We'll protect our own. We proved that.

ParentB_4.speaker: Komira
ParentB_4.text: I don't know about you, but I won't shed a tear for those druids. They hated us from the get go.

ParentA_0.speaker: Locke
ParentA_0.text: Never thought the druids would attack. Thank you. We were lucky to have you.

ParentA_1.speaker: Locke
ParentA_1.text: May this be the last fight any of us see for a while.

ParentA_2.speaker: Locke
ParentA_2.text: Blood has followed us since Elturel. I just want to leave this place and never look back.
ParentA_2.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, tired, grieving for your daughter but grateful

ParentA_3.speaker: Locke
ParentA_3.text: Dead druids means my daughter Arabella saw some justice. Thank you.
ParentA_3.context: NodeContext: Exhausted, tired, grieving for your daughter but grateful

ParentA_4.speaker: Locke
ParentA_4.text: Damn it. Why did it come to this?
ParentA_4.context: NodeContext: Fearful - you're not a fighter and you're hidden alongside the other tieflings.

AD_DruidOpposed_0.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed_0.text: Silvanus forgive me for what I must do.

AD_DruidOpposed_1.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed_1.text: I'll defend the tieflings! Stop Kagha!

AD_DruidOpposed_4.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed_4.text: How has it come to this?

AD_DruidOpposed_5.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed_5.text: Stand down! Kagha has misled you!

AD_DruidOpposed_6.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed_6.text: End this before it's too late!

AD_DruidOpposed_7.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed_7.context: NodeContext: Growling like a wolf at the end of this line (may also be SFX).

AD_DruidOpposed_8.speaker: Rath
AD_DruidOpposed_8.text: We are brothers and sisters! Stay your hand!

Tiefling010_0.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_0.text: You stood by us. I thought you might. Glad I was right. You might even hang around and help us deal with goblins, by my reckoning.
Tiefling010_0.context: NodeContext: She's very warm to you. Playful lilt to this without being too light-hearted given the subject matter.

Tiefling010_1.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010_1.text: When we make it to the city, I'm going to bed with a bottle. I'll have bloody earned it. So will you.

AD_Weaponsmith_3.speaker: Dammon
AD_Weaponsmith_3.text: Don't let them reach the children!

AD_Weaponsmith_6.speaker: Dammon
AD_Weaponsmith_6.text: Our weapons can't take much of this.

AD_Weaponsmith_8.speaker: Dammon
AD_Weaponsmith_8.text: If you hit them, make it count!

AD_SonOfChef_0.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_0.text: We're done running. Hold your ground!

AD_SonOfChef_1.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_1.context: NodeContext: The druids that took him and his people in have turned on them and are trying to slaughter them all.

AD_SonOfChef_5.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_5.context: NodeContext: Shouting, in battle. He believes the druids are attacking without cause.

AD_SonOfChef_7.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef_7.text: They welcomed us in. Trecherous snakes...

PickpocketTrader_0.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_0.text: Don't even think about touching the druids' stuff. We called it first.
PickpocketTrader_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Points at herself when she says 'we called it first.'NodeContext: The druids have been killed after they attacked her fellow tieflings. She's planning on looting all of their stuff. Points at herself when she says 'we called it first.'

PickpocketTrader_1.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_1.text: There goes half my customers. But you'll make up the difference, right?
PickpocketTrader_1.context: NodeContext: The druids are all dead. She's miffed to lose her customer base, but is secretly relieved the whole thing is over.

PickpocketTrader_2.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_2.text: Just have to replenish our stock first.
PickpocketTrader_2.context: NodeContext: The druid attack is over - she's planning on looting the druids' belongings.

PickpocketTrader_3.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader_3.text: Hiding with the children, huh? I get it.
PickpocketTrader_3.context: NodeContext: She gets the player wanting to save their own skin by hiding with the children. She's not judging. Said while the druids are attacking.

ProdigyBrother_0.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_0.text: Damn it. How many are there?
ProdigyBrother_0.context: NodeContext: In the middle of the fight - grim and determined.

ProdigyBrother_1.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother_1.text: More blood and death. Don't know about you, but I'll never get used to it.
ProdigyBrother_1.context: NodeContext: Sighing and frustrated, You're glad the tieflings survived but you hate that it was at the cost of other lives.

ProdigySister_0.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_0.text: I'm glad we were here - who knows what would have happened otherwise?

ProdigySister_1.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister_1.context: NodeContext: You'll defend your fellow tieflings to the death - grim, determined and ready to fight

AD_Refugee004_0.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee004_0.text: Bloody druids! You let us in! You gave us shelter!

AD_Refugee004_2.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee004_2.text: The druids have lost it. Find someplace safe!

AD_Refugee004_3.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee004_3.text: It's us or them. We've no other choice.

ServantPlight_0.speaker: Arron
ServantPlight_0.text: This is your last chance. Leave.

ServantPlight_1.speaker: Arron
ServantPlight_1.text: You should leave, before my hands are forced.

RitualDruid3_0.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3_0.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'will'. The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Trainee002_0.speaker: Ide
Trainee002_0.text: You fought them all, didn't you? Whoa.
Trainee002_0.context: NodeContext: Impressed. The druids are dealt with.

Trainee002_1.speaker: Ide
Trainee002_1.text: You better help if the goblins come!
Trainee002_1.context: NodeContext: A bit lecture-y. The druids are dealt with.

Trainee002_2.speaker: Ide
Trainee002_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: CoweringNodeContext: Terrified. The druids have turned on her people and are trying to slaughter them.

RangerTrader_0.speaker: Eramas
RangerTrader_0.text: Thank you for helping us. Seems like there's still a few real adventurers left.

RangerTrader_1.speaker: Eramas
RangerTrader_1.text: Those 'adventurers' ran at the slightest sound of trouble. At least they left their goods. Take your pick.
RangerTrader_1.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Making air quotes when she says the word 'adventurers'.NodeContext: After the battle. Adventurers is ironic. She makes air quotes while she says it.
ChadD: Pitstop did not follow this direction. If the line is ok as it leave it.

RangerTrader_2.speaker: Eramas
RangerTrader_2.text: I knew it. Damn druids. Get ready!
RangerTrader_2.context: NodeContext: Getting ready for battle. She's bitter - she knew this was inevitable, but hoped it wouldn't happen.

Protester1_0.speaker: Rechel
Protester1_0.text: The druids have gone mad - save yourself!
Protester1_0.context: NodeContext: Urgent - there's a bloody fight between druids and refugees unfolding in the grove

Protester1_1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1_1.text: Look at this place. Some safe haven it turned out to be.

Protester1_2.speaker: Rechel
Protester1_2.text: The whole place smells of blood. If I could be anywhere else...

DruidGuard003_0.speaker: Mino
DruidGuard003_0.text: You outsiders had your chance to leave. Now blood's going to be spilled.
DruidGuard003_0.context: NodeContext: Combative. A fight's about to break out.

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_0.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_0.text: This place could use a little light.
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_0.context: NodeContext: a little wry. she wants to cut down some trees.

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_1.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_1.text: I should probably bother Dammon for some tools.

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_2.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_2.text: You'd get a good few spears out of this one.

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_3.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_3.text: This one looks to be in good health.
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack_3.context: NodeContext: appraising it for the kind of wood it'd make

Tiefling004_0.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004_0.text: I'll take you all on! Just try me.

Tiefling004_1.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004_1.text: No druids left to stop me from cutting down trees and making a nice barricade.

Tiefling004_2.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004_2.text: Tired of washing blood off my hands.

Stargazer_0.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer_0.text: Don't look at me! Those druids are out for blood.

Stargazer_1.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer_1.text: Wouldn't be surprised if the earth opens up and swallows us at this point.

Stargazer_2.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer_2.text: This fight's over, but there will be more.

AD_Trainer_0.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_0.text: Children - find a place to hide. Don't come out 'til I call.

AD_Trainer_1.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_1.text: This is going to end in blood.
AD_Trainer_1.context: NodeContext: Wary, approaching the scene of a confrontation

AD_Trainer_2.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_2.context: NodeContext: Druids are squaring up to his people, ready to start a fight

AD_Trainer_3.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_3.context: NodeContext: Starting a fight, impatient and angry

AD_Trainer_4.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_4.text: We don't just lie down and die!
AD_Trainer_4.context: NodeContext: Starting a fight, impatient and angry

AD_Trainer_5.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_5.context: NodeContext: Druids are squaring up to his people, ready to start a fight

AD_Trainer_6.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_6.text: Halsin's master of this place, not you.
AD_Trainer_6.context: NodeContext: Druids are squaring up to his people, ready to start a fight

AD_Trainer_7.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_7.context: NodeContext: Wary, approaching the scene of a confrontation

AD_Trainer_8.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_8.context: NodeContext: Starting a fight, impatient and angry

AD_Trainer_9.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer_9.context: NodeContext: Wary, approaching the scene of a confrontation

AD_ServantPlight_5.speaker: Arron
AD_ServantPlight_5.text: Ack. Mistress Kagha said it might come to this...

AD_ServantPlight_6.speaker: Arron
AD_ServantPlight_6.text: Oak Father, I pray this path is right.

AD_ServantPlight_8.speaker: Arron
AD_ServantPlight_8.text: Forgive all of us, Oak Father.

Tiefling001_0.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_0.text: Killing goblins is one thing, but this...
Tiefling001_0.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

Tiefling001_3.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_3.text: ... I think I'm going to be sick.
Tiefling001_3.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

Tiefling001_1.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_1.text: The druids will kill us - help us, please!
Tiefling001_1.context: NodeContext: She's about to be attacked.

Tiefling001_2.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001_2.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

LINE_DruidToCombat_0.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: (idol stolen)InternalNodeContext: Reaction from druids if players steal the idol in their vicinity without being pacified first.

LINE_DruidToCombat_3.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat_3.text: The time has come. Remove the outsiders.
LINE_DruidToCombat_3.context: NodeContext: A grim conclusion at the end - a call for a huge battle between druids and tieflings.

LINE_DruidToCombat_5.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat_5.context: NodeContext: Calling for the druids to attack all the inhabitants of the grove.

LINE_DruidToCombat_1.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Position: not in lair, not in cave)

LINE_DruidToCombat_4.speaker: Kagha
LINE_DruidToCombat_4.text: The outlander has betrayed us. I should have known. Druids! We cannot compromise any longer!
LINE_DruidToCombat_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: (position: in lair, Kagha)InternalNodeContext: From attacking Kagha in gameplay (or performing any kind of crime that turns them hostile). Kagha reacts in priority if she is available. AFTER PATCH 5: this should be hooked to the node Sentry Druid so the rest of the scene playsNodeContext: Furious, calling the druids to arms.

LINE_DruidToCombat_6.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat_6.text: The time has come. Remove the outsiders.
LINE_DruidToCombat_6.context:
CinematicNodeContext: (position: in lair, Kagha already talked / fallback)InternalNodeContext: From SnakesCourt or DEN_ShadowDruid_Leader
Or, if Kagha is not available to speak

DruidOpposed_0.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_0.text: We've won, yes, but at what cost? The peace of this grove has been shattered forever.

DruidOpposed_2.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed_2.text: I can handle myself. Find Kagha and end this!

CharmedKid_1.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedKid_1.text: I wish you could stay with us - you'd keep everyone safe forever.

Wyll_1.speaker: Wyll
Wyll_1.text: On your guard. Goblins are coming. I can smell them.

ZenBear_0.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear_0.text: You ruined it! You ruined Master's grove!

ZenBear_2.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear_2.text: You will regret this, two-legs. No cave is deep enough to hide you.

Trainee003_0.speaker: Gan
Trainee003_0.text: Leave one for me next time! A little one.
Trainee003_0.context: NodeContext: Acting tough. The druids are dealt with.

Trainee003_1.speaker: Gan
Trainee003_1.text: There's no druids left for us! No fair!
Trainee003_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands on hips. The druids are dealt with.NodeContext: Childish

Trainee003_2.speaker: Gan
Trainee003_2.text: Don't worry about us. I'll stab anyone who sneaks in.
Trainee003_2.context: NodeContext: Acting tough. She's hiding with the other children while the druids attack.

Protester2_0.speaker: Amek
Protester2_0.text: I hope that lot burn in whatever hell they're destined for.
Protester2_0.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Still keyed-up and outraged at what's happened.

Protester2_1.speaker: Amek
Protester2_1.context: NodeContext: Urgent, alarmed - a fight's ongoing between the two factions

Protester2_2.speaker: Amek
Protester2_2.text: Can you believe those druids? Taking us in, then turning on us? Savages.
Protester2_2.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Still keyed-up and outraged at what's happened.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_1.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_1.text: We had the druids to worry us before. Not anymore. We can defend this place.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_3.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_3.text: Look down there. Plenty of space for traps.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_4.speaker: Asharak
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_4.text: That'd sort them right out. I'll put someone on it.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_6.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_6.text: We should load up on oil. Bring it down on the goblins when they come.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_5.speaker: Asharak
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_5.text: Not sure if we've got any. I'll find out.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_7.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack_7.text: Lady down some barricades. We already have the high ground - best to make use of it.

DruidGuard001_0.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001_0.text: Time to reclaim our grove. Stand in our way and we'll cut you down.
DruidGuard001_0.context: NodeContext: Combative. Spoken just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.

AD_FoodTrader_1.speaker: Okta
AD_FoodTrader_1.text: Don't just bloody stand there - find cover!
AD_FoodTrader_1.context: NodeContext: Yelling over her shoulder at the other tieflings to hide.

AD_FoodTrader_3.speaker: Okta
AD_FoodTrader_3.text: I'll rush 'em if they break through.

AD_DruidLeader_2.speaker: Kagha
AD_DruidLeader_2.text: I am the will of Silvanus!

AD_DruidGuard1_0.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1_0.context: NodeContext: Moving to attack - combat imminent

AD_DruidGuard1_1.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1_1.text: Purge the outsiders! Take back our grove!
AD_DruidGuard1_1.context: NodeContext: Rallying cry just before combat

AD_DruidGuard1_2.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1_2.text: Kagha wills it! Silvanus wills it!

AD_DruidGuard1_4.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1_4.text: No mercy - they had their chance!
AD_DruidGuard1_4.context: NodeContext: Rallying cry just before combat

AD_DruidGuard1_5.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1_5.context: NodeContext: Moving to attack - combat imminent

AD_DruidGuard1_6.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1_6.context: NodeContext: Moving to attack - combat imminent

AD_DruidGuard1_7.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1_7.text: Spare no one - cleanse the grove!

AD_DruidGuard1_8.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1_8.text: You should have left when you had the chance!
AD_DruidGuard1_8.context: NodeContext: Rallying cry just before combat

AD_FleeAfter_0.speaker: Zorru
AD_FleeAfter_0.text: Vicious gith. Murderous druids. I've had enough!

AD_Apprentice_3.speaker: Nettie
AD_Apprentice_3.text: We'll protect the grove, no matter the cost.

Weaponsmith_PostEA_5.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA_5.text: I've got a dozen weapons to reforge. Goblins better not get here first.

Weaponsmith_PostEA_10.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA_10.text: We managed against the druids, but half our weapons are bent or broken.

Weaponsmith_PostEA_3.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA_3.text: The goblins will run us through unless I get them mended.

Weaponsmith_PostEA_0.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_PostEA_0.text: How are you managing to forge anything out here?

Weaponsmith_PostEA_9.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA_9.text: When Elturel fell into Avernus, I was drafted into an infernal forge. Learned a few techniques for making a lot out of a little.

Weaponsmith_PostEA_4.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA_4.text: Between you and me, there's nothing in all the realms like the utter power of infernal machinery. Can't replicate it outside the Hells. Probably for the best.

Weaponsmith_PostEA_14.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA_14.text: Though I wouldn't mind a bit of hellfire to put to use protecting this place.

Weaponsmith_PostEA_7.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_PostEA_7.text: When do you think the goblins will attack?

Weaponsmith_PostEA_2.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA_2.text: Could be a day or a season - bad timing for us either way.

Weaponsmith_PostEA_6.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA_6.text: We'll just have to prepare as best we can.

AD_HideoutLeader_1.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutLeader_1.context: NodeContext: quiet, terrified, they're hiding from an attack

AD_HideoutLeader_0.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader_0.text: No, Zaki. It'll be over soon.

AD_HideoutLeader_2.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutLeader_2.context: NodeContext: quiet, terrified, they're hiding from an attack

AD_HideoutLeader_3.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader_3.text: I've always protected you, haven't I?
AD_HideoutLeader_3.context: NodeContext: trying to sound brave, but scared

AD_HideoutLeader_5.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader_5.context: NodeContext: trying to sound brave - scared

AD_HideoutLeader_4.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutLeader_4.context: NodeContext: quiet, terrified, they're hiding from an attack

Apprentice_0.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice_0.text: Better that Master Halsin doesn't see this. It'd break his heart.
